messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: shakudo tanto/small wak tsuba opinion needed
messages.msgSnippet: Milt, It does resemble your guard and looks even more like typical Kaga work.  Check out the Kaga Kinko Taikan, NBTHK Ishikawa branch, 1983. Jim If you have
messages.messageBody:
Milt,
It does resemble your guard and looks even more like typical Kaga work. Check out the Kaga Kinko Taikan, NBTHK Ishikawa branch, 1983.

Jim

If you have this catalog by S. Izzard about the Mosle collection,
then please check out page 48-48, tsuba with cricket and hanging ivy.
I see similarity in the workmanship when compare to the shakudo
wak/tanto tsuba I have in the pic album.
Izzard called his example Umetada school.

milt

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

It looks like Kaga-zogan.

Jim

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: shakudo tanto/small wak tsuba opinion needed
messages.msgSnippet: Milt, My thoughts on the little one were Umetada school. The inlay isn t right for Kaga. Kaga tsuba trike me more as the surface is super-prepared, then the
messages.messageBody:
Milt,

My thoughts on the little one were Umetada school. The
inlay isn't right for Kaga. Kaga tsuba trike me more
as the surface is super-prepared, then the inlay deep
or hard set somehow burnished, then surface prepared
again.
Your tsuba has more the layered felling of an
Umetada school tsuba. Clean, laid on/in, and left so.
I don't think I have the Izzard catalog.

Curran

<MuramasaIII@a...> wrote:
>
> please klick.........
>
> http://tinyurl.com/5ezgc
>
> Kaga school , Sendai School ??
> Shakudo is polished smooth and almost purple black in color.

Gang,
I trust everyone have a good time after their Christmas
dinner ...........
If you have this catalog by S. Izzard about the Mosle collection,
then please check out page 48-48, tsuba with cricket and hanging ivy.
I see similarity in the workmanship when compare to the shakudo
wak/tanto tsuba I have in the pic album.
Izzard called his example Umetada school.
I could be drunk from that fine Bechtolsheimer Klossterberg
Beerenauslese 1998 but..............

milt
